admin.name: Ananya Rajagopal
admin.interests: Human Computer Interaction, Fintech, Product Management
admin.fact: I make a mean pesto pasta
admin.advice: The people around you are your biggest resource! Don’t be afraid to ask people about their experiences and/or for a helping hand- more often than not they’re so happy to do so.

admin.name: Sailaja Nallacheruvu
admin.involvements: SWE Team Tech, Reflections | Projections, CS STARS
admin.fact: I have a black belt in Taekwondo!
admin.advice: Try everything! You never know what things you might enjoy that you'd never considered as an interest before.

admin.name: Rayna Wuh
admin.involvements: CS 124 Honors, ACM, The Daily Illini
admin.interests: Web Dev, Ethical impacts of technology
admin.hobbies: Making things pink, crochet, reading, baking
admin.advice: To have confidence in myself and my skills. You are all incredibly talented and capable people— you can and should take ownership of your accomplishments !

admin.name: Aarthi Balaji
admin.involvements: IBC, GFX Think Scholars ELA this fall
admin.interests: AI, Animation, UI/UX design, App Development, Space technology
admin.hobbies: I love to bike ride, read, go to a coffee shop/library, or watch movies.
admin.fact: I used to have a pet fish and his name was Pluto because he was small and his scales were blue/purple.
admin.advice: I wish I'd known that as a freshman, everyone else is just as new to college as I am! Remember that your classmates and people in your dorm are willing to help and support you in your endeavors, so don't be afraid to reach out to someone new. Being able to take part in shared experiences with people from different backgrounds will allow you to grow in all aspects of your life!

admin.name: Divya Koya
admin.hobbies: Drawing, reading, going to the gym
admin.fact: I love tea! The first tea I ever had was green tea and it's my favorite.
admin.advice: Join RSOs! Of course, don't overcommit yourself, but RSOs are such a great way to meet new people and you'll make some really cool friends, especially because you all share a common interest if you're in a club together.

admin.name: Riya Jain
admin.fact: A fun fact about me is that I'm left-handed!
admin.advice: You meet a lot of people in college, but maintaining relationships and friendships is difficult because everyone operates on very different schedules. If you want to make solid friendships, go out of your way to meet up. One text can go a long way.

admin.name: Akriti Arora
admin.hobbies: Painting, travelling, sleeping, walking to random places, and meeting people
admin.fact: I learnt to read a regional language by looking at signboards
admin.advice: Chilling and having fun needs to have a separate place in your calendar because it’s as important as everything else

admin.name: Jillian Nylund
admin.place: City in middle of nowhere virginia :)
admin.involvements: Girls Who Code, Tau Beta Pi (Engineering Honor Society), Ice Skating
admin.interests: I don’t know yet! I’m excited to explore everything!
admin.fact: I can solve a Rubix cube in under a minute (probably)
admin.advice: Everyone is as clueless as you.

admin.name: Shreya Vinjamuri
admin.involvements: I'm also involved in CS STARS, where I undertake research in the motion planning lab and volunteer as part of the recruiting group.
admin.interests: AI, data science, motion planning, robotics
admin.hobbies: Playing basketball, painting, reading, and going on walks
admin.fact: I've travelled to 3 different countries in the past year.
admin.advice: I wish I knew about how important it is to take advantage of resources, support, and not be afraid to ask for extra help, especially at office hours!

admin.name: Anushri Mittal
admin.fact: I have touched a crocodile, fed a giraffe, and watched a lionness hunt in Masaimara!
admin.advice: It's just as important to spend time meeting people and learning from their experiences as it is to learn technical content from your classes!

admin.name: Neha Vardhaman
admin.involvements: Software Developer for Hack4Impact, Undergraduate Research Assistant in Disaster Relief and Resilience
admin.hobbies: Photography, crafting, getting coffee/food with friends
admin.fact: I spent the summer researching in Puerto Rico!
admin.advice: Don't limit yourself academically or socially—be open minded to trying new things because college is a great opportunity to explore new passions and different aspects of your identity!

admin.name: Kalika Raje
admin.fact: I've been on a plane more than 60 times
admin.advice: It's ok if your transition to college isn't going as smoothly as people make it seem

admin.name: Shreya Deshpande
admin.involvements: Reflections|Projections, Developer for ITI, UIUC Dheem
admin.fact: I have a black belt in Taekwondo!
admin.advice: It's important to take a break and have fun sometimes!

admin.name: Akshata Tiwari
admin.hobbies: Painting, hiking, working out, spending time with family & friends
admin.fact: One of my paintings is in the home of a former FIFA champion!!
admin.advice: Spend time with different people and make new friends from all over the world and from different grades! It's really easy to be caught up in the high school mindset and do things in your comfort zone, but try to expand your horizons - both socially and academically :)

admin.name: Garima Sharma
admin.involvements: Reflections | Projections, ACM, CS STARS / Undergraduate Research
admin.interests: HCI (Human-Computer Interaction), Antisocial Computing, Product Management
admin.hobbies: Reading books, drinking coffee, exploring farmer's markets
admin.fact: I have been on my favorite coffee shop's (Brewlab's) Instagram!
admin.advice: Don't be afraid to reach out if you need support - we want you to succeed!

admin.name: Kavya Puranam
admin.interests: Digital Agriculture, AI, Data Science, Bioinformatics
admin.hobbies: Knitting and crocheting, hiking and biking, listening to music
admin.fact: I did figure skating for 8 years!
admin.advice: I wish I learned how to balance my time between academics and free time better so I would be less stressed.

admin.name: Twinkle Yeruva
admin.advice: Take advantage of the events and career fairs offered through the Grainger College of Engineering
